intro: Cecropia scabrifolia, commonly known as the rough-leaved cecropia, is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family and is native to tropical regions of Central and South America. It is a fast-growing, evergreen tree characterized by its dark green, rough-textured leaves and distinctive, pendulous inflorescences. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers followed by orange or red fruits that contain toxic seeds. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in rainforests and secondary growth areas. Cecropia scabrifolia is also known for its role in supporting local wildlife, including various insects and birds.
